actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Personnel and Police.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To provide that rates of pay for Members of Congress shall not reflect any of the increases recently recommended by the President under the Federal Salary Act of 1967, and to provide that Members' pay may not be increased unless the Federal budget is in balance.

summary.text: Requires that the rate of pay for Members of Congress be determined as if the recommendations of the President relating to such pay rates had been disapproved. Prohibits an increase in such pay unless the Federal budget is balanced. Describes methods for determining if the budget is balanced.

titles.title: To provide that rates of pay for Members of Congress shall not reflect any of the increases recently recommended by the President under the Federal Salary Act of 1967, and to provide that Members' pay may not be increased unless the Federal budget is in balance.
